channel.title: Mark Hazleton Projects
channel.description: Latest project updates and releases from Mark Hazleton's portfolio.

item.title: Frogsfolly.com Main
item.description: Web Project Mechanics is a comprehensive content management system (CMS) built on ASP.Net, designed for managing multiple websites efficiently using a single MS-Access database. Developed over 20 years, it offers caching for enhanced performance and operates without external dependencies. | Technologies: ASP.Net, CMS, Web Application, Visual Basic .NET, Multi-site Management | Stage: Build and Deploy
item.content:encoded:
Summary

Web Project Mechanics is a comprehensive content management system (CMS) built on ASP.Net, designed for managing multiple websites efficiently using a single MS-Access database. Developed over 20 years, it offers caching for enhanced performance and operates without external dependencies.

Description

Frogsfolly.com is the original website I created in 1999 when learning web technologies.

Technologies

ASP.Net, CMS, Web Application, Visual Basic .NET, Multi-site Management, MS-Access

Live Demo

View Project

View Repository

item.title: Data Analytics Web Project Manager
item.description: DAWPM is a modern web application that leverages ASP.NET WebForms and Bootstrap to provide advanced data processing capabilities, including dynamic charting and pivot analysis, transforming CSV data into actionable insights. | Technologies: Data Analytics, CSV Processing, ASP.NET WebForms, Bootstrap, Interactive Visualizations | Stage: Development
item.content:encoded:
Summary

DAWPM is a modern web application that leverages ASP.NET WebForms and Bootstrap to provide advanced data processing capabilities, including dynamic charting and pivot analysis, transforming CSV data into actionable insights.

Description

A comprehensive web application that transforms CSV data into interactive visualizations and analytics using ASP.NET WebForms and Bootstrap.

Technologies

Data Analytics, CSV Processing, ASP.NET WebForms, Bootstrap, Interactive Visualizations, Pivot Tables

item.title: Mechanics of Motherhood: Recipe Management Platform
item.description: Discover the Mechanics of Motherhood, a recipe management platform tailored for working mothers. Featuring 108+ recipes, mobile-first design, and PWA capabilities, it transforms kitchen chaos into culinary success. | Technologies: recipe management, React, TypeScript, PWA, mobile-first | Stage: Deployment to GitHub Pages
item.content:encoded:
Summary

Discover the Mechanics of Motherhood, a recipe management platform tailored for working mothers. Featuring 108+ recipes, mobile-first design, and PWA capabilities, it transforms kitchen chaos into culinary success.

Description

Mechanics of Motherhood is a modern web application designed to streamline recipe management for busy working mothers. Built with React and TypeScript, it offers over 108 curated recipes, smart categorization, and a mobile-first design, ensuring an organized culinary experience.

Technologies

recipe management, React, TypeScript, PWA, mobile-first, cooking, mothers, food

Live Demo

View Project

Source Code

View Repository

item.title: PrismSpark: Advanced C#/.NET Syntax Highlighting Library
item.description: High-performance C#/.NET library for syntax highlighting and theming, porting PrismJS for web applications. | Technologies: C#, .NET, PrismJS, syntax highlighting, web applications | Stage: Development
item.content:encoded:
Summary

High-performance C#/.NET library for syntax highlighting and theming, porting PrismJS for web applications.

Description

PrismSpark is a high-performance C#/.NET library that ports PrismJS for syntax highlighting, theming, and extensibility in web applications, supporting over 20 languages with advanced features.

Technologies

C#, .NET, PrismJS, syntax highlighting, web applications, theming, extensibility, high-performance

Live Demo

View Project

Source Code

View Repository

Release Notes

Currently no CI/CD workflows detected. Consider integrating for automated testing and deployment.

Description

WebSpark.ArtSpark is an innovative .NET 9 web application that combines art exploration with cutting-edge AI technology. Built using the Art Institute of Chicago API and OpenAI integration, this platform demonstrates modern web development practices including Semantic Kernel, Entity Framework Core, and responsive Bootstrap design.

Technologies

WebSpark.ArtSpark, Mark Hazleton, Web Project, Portfolio
